parameters:
\N<???>...It seems to have gone well. I can't judge from here, but
it appears the matter is settled.
\N<???>...I hope that's the case.
\N<???>Let's believe that our actions here were not in vain.

\N<???>Yes... If we believe that, the events that have befallen us
may feel somewhat redeemed.
\N<???>Won't you go to see him...?

\N<???>...Yes. What good would it do for me to show my face to my
son now? It would only serve as a shackle on his future.

\N<???>Neither my late husband nor I would wish for that. I will
simply continue on with my life at my own pace.
\N<???>What about you...? Don't you need to see her?

\N<???>...Yes. I feel the same way. There is no longer any room for
me in my daughter's life.

\N<???>If she knew I was still alive, it might even hinder the
vitality she needs to live.

\N<???>So the desire for revenge against Luda, who took you and
her father from her, has become her sustenance...?
\N<???>Perhaps... But.

\N<???>They have been out of our hands for a long time. It's not
something to mourn. Besides... don't we still have things we
must do?

\N<???>For that, we need your strength. Could you lend me your
power for a little while longer?
\N<???>Yes... As you wish.
A

\N<Seno>...It seems to have gone well, Princess Consort. I can't
tell from here, but it looks like things have been decided.
\N<Princess Consort Suia>...I hope that's the case.

\N<Seno>Let's believe that our actions here were not in vain. They
were essential for Yuia-sama and Segi.

\N<Princess Consort Suia>Yes... If I believe that, then what has happened to me feels
somewhat redeemed.
\N<Seno>Won't you meet with Yuia-sama...?

\N<Princess Consort Suia>...Yes. What good would it do for me to show my face to my
son now? It would only hinder his future.

\N<Princess Consort Suia>Neither my late husband nor I would wish for that. I will
simply continue on with my life at my own pace.
\N<Princess Consort Suia>What about you? Are you not going to meet with Segi?

\N<Seno>...Yes. I feel the same as you, Princess Consort. There is
no longer a place for me in my daughter's life.

\N<Seno>If she knew I was still alive, it might even become an
obstacle to her living with vigor.

\N<Princess Consort Suia>So her desire for revenge against Luda, who took you and
her father from her, has become her sustenance...?
\N<Seno>Perhaps... but that's how it is.
\N<Former Duchy Soldier>Princess Consort... Lady Seno...!

\N<Princess Consort Suia>They have been out of our hands for a long time. It's not
something to mourn. Besides... we still have things we must
do, right?

\N<Princess Consort Suia>For that, we need the strength of Orugi, Seno, and all of
you. Could you lend me your strength for a little while
longer?
\N<Seno>Yes... As you wish.
\N<Orugi>My life is always... for the Princess Consort.
A

\N<Training Troops Receptionist>I... owe you an apology. When I first heard you were going
to fight in the Training Troops, I laughed at you in my
heart.

\N<Training Troops Receptionist>I thought it would just be a repeat of the same misfortune
I've seen so many times... I underestimated you because
you're a woman.
\N<Segi>That's... understandable. Please, don't worry about it.

\N<Training Troops Receptionist>No... that's exactly why I felt I should say something. I
thought I had been watching you closely... but I'm ashamed
that I didn't see your potential.

\N<Training Troops Receptionist>Yuia...san, was it? Your wife is... an amazing woman. A
woman to be proud of.
\N<Yuia>...
\N<Segi>More importantly... where are you taking us?
\N<Training Troops Receptionist>...Here. Are you ready? I'm going to open it...?
\N<Yuia>Wha...t!!??
\N<Yuia>Mo...ther...
\N<Segi>Fa...father... mo...mother...
\N<Princess Consort Suia>...
\N<Seno>Segi...
\N<Orugi>...
\N<Segi>You're safe... I believed... you would be...
\N<Seno>...Yes.

\N<Princess Consort Suia>...Why... have you brought them here? We asked that our
existence be kept confidential.

\N<Training Troops Receptionist>...I'm sorry. But now that things have been settled, it
would be too cruel to never let them see each other again...
\N<Princess Consort Suia>...

\N<Training Troops Receptionist>I apologize again. It seems I was too hasty. It was just my
personal sentimentality.
\N<Princess Consort Suia>No... if anything, we are the ones who should apologize.

\N<Princess Consort Suia>I thank you... We were wrong. We should not have left like
this.
\N<Training Troops Receptionist>Is that so... I'm glad.

\N<Yuia>Mo...ther, where have you been all this time... And Orugi
and Seno are safe too...
\N<Orugi>Ah... we have caused you concern.

\N<Seno>Lord Yuia... it has been a long time. As you can see, both
of us are unharmed.

\N<Princess Consort Suia>Yuia... Segi. I have been informed of the whole story. You
both did very well...
\N<Segi>Princess Consort...

\N<Princess Consort Suia>You two have achieved more than we could have hoped for.
However, because of that, we cannot afford to waste even a
moment. There is little time to rejoice in our reunion.

\N<Yuia>Wha... what do you mean, mother? And why are... the three of
you here...?

\N<Seno>...Lord Yuia, as the Princess Consort said, we do not have
the luxury of time to discuss this matter leisurely right
now.
\N<Yuia>But... wait! Let's leave this place together!

\N<Yuia>If I'm not mistaken, mother and the others have been
captives of Luda until now, right? With Zuuteruka defeated
and their control in disarray, we might be able to
escape...!
\N<Princess Consort Suia>No... we will stay here. We cannot go with you.
\N<Segi>How can that be... after finally being able to meet again...

\N<Princess Consort Suia>There is a reason we cannot leave. We have left behind those
who share your blood with Luda.
\N<Yuia>My... siblings...!?

\N<Princess Consort Suia>...Yes. No matter where or how they came into being, they
are my children... your siblings.

\N<Princess Consort Suia>If we leave now with you, they will be persecuted. Knowing
that, as a mother, I cannot be so heartless as to abandon
them.

\N<Princess Consort Suia>From now on, we must devise a plan with those here to take
back our children into our care.
\N<Yuia>Mother...

\N<Princess Consort Suia>That is why we intended to keep our existence hidden from
you. After secretly accomplishing our goal, we planned to
disappear from your lives...
\N<Princess Consort Suia>However... it seems that was a mistake.

\N<Princess Consort Suia>Yuia, Segi... I'm glad we could meet you... After so long, I
can clearly see the hope that I hadn't seen in a while.

\N<Segi>But... didn't you all help us? With that thing from
Zuuteruka earlier...
\N<Seno>...

\N<Orugi>No, Segi... it's thanks to you. You did well. It's because
you opened the innermost door of that ancient ruin.
\N<Segi>Eh...?

\N<Orugi>After that door was opened, our soldiers entered the room
and successfully retrieved it.

\N<Segi>Wait, Father... what are you talking about? What do you
mean...?

\N<Seno>A single drop of that liquid is sufficient. All that was
left was to mix it with Zuuteruka's Mind Luda...
\N<Segi>What do you mean...?
\N<Segi>Tell me... what was in that room? Why did Zuuteruka...

\N<Princess Consort Suia>That was the very wish of the Dawn's Ear entrusted by my
late husband to his legitimate son Yuia, placed upon a
necklace.

\N<Princess Consort Suia>And at the same time, it was a secret method to create even
a small but deep hole in Luda's control.
\N<Princess Consort Suia>In short... it's an antidote to Mind Luda.
\N<Segi>...A drug that negates the effects of Mind Luda...?

\N<Princess Consort Suia>Yes. As you know, that spiritual medicine, when used on men,
enhances physical strength and brings out a heightened will
to fight, while also increasing ferocity.

\N<Princess Consort Suia>Originally developed to dispel aversion to war, the
medicine's effects also became a distant cause for Luda's
expansion of control.
\N<Yuia>...

\N<Princess Consort Suia>On the other hand, when used on women, it enhances physical
strength and induces an irresistible aphrodisiac effect.
\N<Segi>...

\N<Princess Consort Suia>In other words, it was employed as a spiritual medicine that
produces a synergistic effect when administered to both men
and women.

\N<Princess Consort Suia>This has been... deeply rooted in the core of Luda's
control.

\N<Princess Consort Suia>However... no matter how it is disguised, it is ultimately a
double-edged spiritual medicine that destroys the user. Once
administered, there is no resisting it, and one will be
tormented by its effects until death.
\N<Segi>So, what was in that bottle... that single drop...?

\N<Princess Consort Suia>...Exactly. That is why the great ducal house of Dawn's Ear
once sent trusted confidants to this city to protect this
secret method.
\N<Yuia>...

\N<Segi>Please wait... then Lord Yuia, you should have known about
this, right...?

\N<Segi>That's why when escaping the country, you relied on this
city...
\N<Yuia>No... I wasn't fully informed either.

\N<Yuia>I only knew that there was something capable of shaking
Luda's control... but I didn't know what it was or where it
existed.

\N<Orugi>...It was for caution. The Princess Consort bet on Lord Yuia
finding the antidote and launching a counterattack against
Luda. And you, sir, have won that bet splendidly...
\N<Yuia>...It wasn't my power. It was yours, Segi.

\N<Segi>That can't be... It's because Lord Yuia entrusted the
necklace to Riia just in case...

\N<Yuia>However, Mother. Who exactly are these people...? It seems
like there are only a few surviving soldiers of the country
here...

\N<Princess Consort Suia>That's right. This issue couldn't be resolved with just the
forces here.
\N<Yuia>Then how did you manage to...

\N<Princess Consort Suia>However... if we had sufficient reinforcements, it would be
a different story. Seno and I realized this... or perhaps it
would be more accurate to say we were made to realize.
\N<Seno>...

\N<Princess Consort Suia>The ability to make the most of one's position is...
something. To discern who is an enemy and who can become an
ally... there is a way.

\N<Princess Consort Suia>Being taken captive, continuously embraced by those we do
not desire, defiled over and over. And carrying their
children.
\N<Yuia>Mother...
\N<Segi>Mom...
\N<Orugi>...

\N<Princess Consort Suia>Ravished and violated at their whim. Yet why do Luda's
soldiers still flock to us?
\N<Princess Consort Suia>I realized... it's because of our qualities as women.
\N<Segi>Qualities as... women...

\N<Seno>That's right. Realizing that being sought after by many
means you can captivate many was the key.
\N<Princess Consort Suia>After reuniting with Orugi... I was made to realize this.
\N<Orugi>...

\N<Princess Consort Suia>Although our reunion was brief, fortunately, there was
enough time. In the space we had alone, I had enough time to
secretly convey this plan to him.
\N<Orugi>...

\N<Yuia>I see... so you gathered Luda's soldiers and the remnants
who would agree...

\N<Princess Consort Suia>Exactly. Since being transferred to this city, we have been
secretly planning and acting in concert with Orugi.

\N<Princess Consort Suia>Fortunately, there were those within Luda's ranks who were
troubled by this situation.

\N<Seno>...That's natural. Mind. If Luda used his power to rapidly
expand his control, the more quickly the fabric would begin
to unravel.

\N<Seno>Not everyone is a sheep that will kneel and lick boots when
shouted down.
\N<Yuia>...

\N<Segi>...There was nothing in the bottle. That's why... I had
given up, thinking it was all in vain...

\N<Seno>It wasn't in vain at all. It's precisely because you, Lord
Yuia... and all of us put our desperate thoughts and
feelings into it that things worked out.

\N<Orugi>That's right, Segi. You did well. What Mother just spoke
of... that is exactly what Zuuteruka could not achieve even
if he tried.

\N<Orugi>That's why he rushed to create his own private army. He
desired a private army that would be devoted only to him and
would dirty their hands for him, not for Luda.

\N<Orugi>The more he showed his power, the more people would be
charmed and come swaying to it.

\N<Orugi>However, if they feared that power, eventually they would
come to dread it, and some would join forces with those who
would take up arms against it.
\N<Orugi>He... must have known at his core what he lacked.
\N<Yuia>...
\N<Segi>...
\N<Princess Consort Suia>Now, Segi... you should also take this.
\N<Segi>Thank you very much...
\N<Segi>With this... Riia can also be saved...
\N<Princess Consort Suia>Yes... there's still time. Don't worry...
\N<Segi>Yes...

\N<Yuia>Orugi, Seno. Once again, I find myself in your debt... I
feel bitter about my own powerlessness.

\N<Seno>Lord Yuia, please raise your head. The reason I can offer
you my unreserved assistance is because you are a person of
such worth.

\N<Seno>When one seeks help from those around them, if they do not
possess the necessary virtue, no one will come to their aid.
You have that worth... that's all there is to it.
\N<Yuia>Seno...

\N<Princess Consort Suia>Exactly. And as your mother, I am proud to have raised such
a person.
\N<Segi>Thank you so much... Dad, Mom. And Princess Consort...

\N<Princess Consort Suia>Yuia, given the current circumstances, I presume you no
longer wish to use your position as a banner for the
country's restoration. That's why... you have the duty to
protect the remaining family with all your might.

\N<Princess Consort Suia>If you do so, eventually your feelings will connect... and
that will one day become the nation itself.

\N<Princess Consort Suia>I am content with that. Surely, your late father would wish
for the same.

\N<Seno>The path that lies ahead for Lord Yuia will be fraught with
thorns. It will not be an easy journey... Segi, you must
support Lord Yuia as you both move forward.

\N<Orugi>However, it is enough to trust each other. When that trust
is lost, the path will turn into an endless wasteland.
\N<Segi>...Understood.
\N<Yuia>I will etch your words into my heart forever.

\N<Princess Consort Suia>It's alright... surely this is not a farewell for this
lifetime. We will... meet again someday.
Until that day...
A

\N<Princess Consort Suia>You two have achieved more than we could have hoped for.

\N<Princess Consort Suia>There is a reason we cannot leave. We have left behind those
who share your blood with Luda.
\N<Yuia>My... siblings...!?

\N<Princess Consort Suia>...Yes. No matter where or how they came into this world,
they are my children... your siblings.

\N<Princess Consort Suia>If we leave now with you, they will be persecuted. Knowing
that, as a mother, I cannot be so heartless as to abandon
them.

\N<Princess Consort Suia>From now on, we who remain here must devise a plan to take
back our children into our hands.
\N<Yuia>Mother...

\N<Princess Consort Suia>That is why we intended not to reveal our existence to you.
After secretly accomplishing our goal... we planned to
disappear from your sight.
\N<Princess Consort Suia>However... it seems that was a mistake.

\N<Princess Consort Suia>Yuia, Segi... I am glad to have met you... A hope that I had
not seen for a long time is now clearly reflected in my
eyes.

\N<Segi>Hey... didn't you all help us? With that thing from

\N<Seno>...

\N<Segi>What do you mean...?
\N<Segi>Tell me... what was in that room? Why did Zuuteruka...

\N<Princess Consort Suia>It's nothing less than an antidote to Mind-Luda.

\N<Yuia>...

rather, we were made to realize.
\N<Seno>...

\N<Princess Consort Suia>What can be maximally utilized given one's position... What
is something that can discern who is an enemy and who is an
ally.

\N<Princess Consort Suia>Being taken captive, continuously embraced by unwanted
partners, defiled over and over. And carrying their seed.
\N<Yuia>Mother...
\N<Segi>Mom...
\N<Orugi>...

\N<Princess Consort Suia>Ravished and violated to their heart's content. Yet why do

\N<Princess Consort Suia>It was then... I realized it was because of our qualities as
women.
\N<Segi>Qualities as women...

\N<Seno>Exactly. Realizing that being swarmed by many meant that we
could ensnare many was synonymous.
\N<Princess Consort Suia>After reuniting with Orugi... I was made to realize that.
\N<Orugi>...

\N<Princess Consort Suia>Although our reunion time was limited, fortunately, there
was enough time. In the space just for the two of us, I had
enough time to secretly convey this plan to him.

\N<Orugi>...

\N<Yuia>I see... So you gathered Luda's soldiers who were
sympathetic and the remnants of the defeated army...

\N<Princess Consort Suia>Precisely. Since being transferred to this city, we have
been secretly planning and acting in concert with Orugi.

\N<Princess Consort Suia>Fortunately, there were those within Luda's ranks who were
troubled by this situation.

\N<Seno>...That's natural. Mind. If Luda is used to rapidly expand
control, the fraying will also begin to spread just as
quickly.

\N<Seno>Not everyone is a sheep that will kneel and lick boots when
shouted down.
\N<Yuia>...

\N<Segi>...There was nothing in the bottle. That's why... I had
given up thinking it was all in vain...

\N<Seno>It wasn't in vain at all. It's precisely because you, Lord
Yuia... and all of us put our desperate thoughts together...
that things worked out.

\N<Orugi>That's right, Segi. You did well. What mother just talked
about... that is exactly what Zuuteruka tried and failed to
achieve.

\N<Orugi>That's why he rushed to create his own private army. He
desired a private army that would be devoted only to him and
would dirty their hands for him, not for Luda.

\N<Orugi>The more power is shown, the more there are those who will
be charmed and flock to it.

\N<Orugi>However, if they fear that power, eventually they will come
to dread it, and soon they will join forces with those who
draw bows against that power.
\N<Orugi>He... must have known at his core what he lacked.
\N<Yuia>...
\N<Segi>...
\N<Princess Consort Suia>Now, Segi... you should take this as well.
\N<Segi>Thank you very much...
\N<Segi>With this... Riia can also be saved...
\N<Princess Consort Suia>Yes... there's still time. Don't worry...
\N<Segi>Yes...

\N<Yuia>Orugi, Seno. Once again, I find myself in your debt... I
feel bitter about my own powerlessness.

\N<Seno>Lord Yuia, please raise your head. The reason I can offer
you my unreserved assistance is because you are a person of
such value.

\N<Seno>When one seeks help from those around them, if they do not
possess the necessary benevolence, no one will come to their
aid. You have that value... that's all there is to it.
\N<Yuia>Seno...

\N<Princess Consort Suia>Exactly. And as a mother, I am proud to have raised you to
be such a person.
\N<Segi>Thank you so much... Dad, Mom. And Princess Consort...

\N<Princess Consort Suia>Yuia, at this point, it is too late to hope for the
restoration of our nation under your banner. That is why...
you have the duty to protect the remaining members of your
family with all your might.

\N<Princess Consort Suia>If you do so, eventually your feelings will connect... and
that will one day become the foundation of a nation.

\N<Princess Consort Suia>I am content with that. Surely, your late father would wish
for the same.

\N<Seno>The path that lies ahead for Lord Yuia will be fraught with
thorns. It will not be an easy journey... Segi, you must
support Lord Yuia as you both move forward.

\N<Orugi>All that matters is that you trust each other. The moment
you lose that trust, the path will turn into an endless
wasteland.
\N<Segi>...Understood.
\N<Yuia>I will etch your words into my heart forever.

\N<Princess Consort Suia>It's alright... surely this is not a farewell for this
lifetime. We will... meet again someday.
Until that day...
A

\N<Training Troops Receptionist>I must apologize to you... When I first heard that you were
going to fight in the Training Troops, I laughed at you in
my heart.

\N<Training Troops Receptionist>I thought it was just another unfortunate repeat... I
underestimated you because you're a woman.
\N<Segi>That's... understandable. Please, don't worry about it.

\N<Training Troops Receptionist>No... That's exactly why I felt I should say something. I
thought I had been watching you closely... but I'm
embarrassed that I didn't see your potential.

\N<Training Troops Receptionist>Yuia...san, was it? Your wife... she's an amazing woman. A
woman to be proud of.
\N<Yuia>...
\N<Segi>More importantly... where are you taking us?
\N<Training Troops Receptionist>...Here. Ready? I'm opening it...?
\N<Segi>Eh...?!!
\N<Yuia>Wha...?!!
\N<Yuia>Mo... Mother...
\N<Segi>Fa... Father... Mo... Mother...
\N<Princess Consort Suia>...
\N<Seno>Segi...
\N<Seno>...
\N<Segi>You're safe... I believed...
\N<Seno>...Yes.

\N<Princess Consort Suia>...Why... did you bring them here? We asked that our
existence be kept confidential.

\N<Training Troops Receptionist>...I'm sorry. But now that things have been decided, it
would be too cruel to never let them see each other again...
\N<Princess Consort Suia>...

\N<Training Troops Receptionist>I apologize again. It seems I was too hasty. It was my
personal sentimentality.
\N<Princess Consort Suia>No... rather, we are the ones who should apologize.

\N<Princess Consort Suia>I thank you... We were wrong. We shouldn't have left like
this.
\N<Training Troops Receptionist>Is that so... Good.

\N<Yuia>Mo... Mother, where have you been all this time... And Seno
is safe too...

\N<Seno>Lord Yuia... It has been a long time. As you can see, I am
unharmed.

\N<Princess Consort Suia>Yuia... Segi. I have been informed of the whole story. You
both did very well...
\N<Segi>Princess Consort...

\N<Princess Consort Suia>You two have achieved more than we could have hoped for.
However, because of that, we cannot afford to waste even a
moment. There is little time to rejoice in our reunion.

\N<Yuia>What do you mean, Mother? And why are... the two of you
here...?

\N<Seno>...Lord Yuia, as the Princess Consort said, now is not the
time to discuss this matter at length.
\N<Yuia>But... wait! Let's leave this place together!

\N<Yuia>If I'm not mistaken, you've been prisoners of Luda until
now, right? With Zuuteruka defeated and their control in
disarray, we might be able to escape...!
\N<Princess Consort Suia>No... we will stay here. We cannot go with you.
\N<Segi>How can this be... after finally being able to meet again...

\N<Princess Consort Suia>There is a reason we cannot leave. We have left someone with
Luda's blood behind.
\N<Yuia>My... sibling...?!

\N<Princess Consort Suia>...Yes. No matter where or how they were born, they are my
child... your sibling.

\N<Princess Consort Suia>If we leave now with you, she will be persecuted. Knowing
that, as a mother, I cannot be so heartless as to abandon
her.
\N<Yuia>Mother...

\N<Princess Consort Suia>That's why we intended not to reveal our existence to you.
After everything was settled in secret... we planned to
disappear from your lives.
\N<Princess Consort Suia>However... it seems that was a mistake.

\N<Princess Consort Suia>Yuia, Segi... I'm glad we could meet. A hope that I hadn't
seen for so long is now clearly reflected in my eyes.

\N<Segi>Right... Mom, you helped us, didn't you? With that thing
about Zuuteruka earlier...
\N<Seno>...Perhaps.
\N<Yuia>Is that so... Seno, I'm in your debt once again...

\N<Seno>Lord Yuia, please raise your head. The reason I can offer
you my unwavering support is because you are a person of
such worth.

\N<Seno>When one seeks help from those around them, if they do not
possess the necessary virtue, no one will come to their aid.
You have that value, Lord Yuia... that's all there is to it.
\N<Yuia>Seno...

\N<Princess Consort Suia>Exactly. And I am proud to have raised you to be such a
person.
\N<Segi>Thank you... Mom, Princess Consort...

\N<Princess Consort Suia>Yuia, now that things have come to this, I presume you no
longer wish to use your status as a rallying point for the
country's restoration. That's why... you have a duty to
protect the remaining family with all your might.

\N<Princess Consort Suia>If you do so, eventually your feelings will connect... and
that will one day become the foundation of a nation.

\N<Princess Consort Suia>I am content with that. Surely your late father would wish
for the same.

\N<Seno>The path Lord Yuia will walk from now on will surely be
fraught with thorns. On that difficult journey... Segi, you
must support Lord Yuia as you move forward together.
\N<Segi>...Understood.
\N<Yuia>I will etch your words into my heart forever.

\N<Princess Consort Suia>It's alright... this won't be our last farewell. Surely...
we will meet again someday.
Until that day...
A
